question: Voltage multipliers take a dc input voltage, and provide a dc output voltage at a multiple of the input.
For a given input frequency, a half-wave rectifier is easier to filter than a full-wave rectifier.
Ripple voltage is caused by the charging and discharging of the filter capacitor.
For greatest reliability, and longest life, diodes should be operated at their maximum ratings.
A diode conducts current when reverse-biased and blocks current when forward-biased.
A single diode in a half-wave rectifier conducts for 180Â° of the input cycle.
Diode limiters add a dc level to an ac signal.
In a diode clamper, the capacitor retains a charge approximately equal to the peak value of the input.
VRRM is the same as PIV rating.
The output voltage of a center-tapped full-wave rectifier equals the secondary output voltage.
